title: Tileable 12-Beaconed Kovarex enrichment process
descriptionMarkdown:
### Tileable 12-Beaconed Kovarex enrichment process

Contents of blueprint book:
- 1x Blueprint: **Kovarex enrichment process (start)** *starting point on top, with the input/outputs*
- 1x Blueprint: **Kovarex enrichment process (expand)** *(to simply add more centrifuges below)*

Input:
- 1x Belt: Uranium-238/dark-green (can be a 'mixed' input with Uranium-235/light-green, directly from the smelter)

Output:
- 1x Belt: Uranium-238/dark-green
- 1x Belt: Uranium-235/light-green

Requirements first-time startup:
- Minimal 40 Uranium-235 (light-green) for top-most starting centrifuge (***so, for each lane/column***, also each time you add a lane)

How to get 40 Uranium-235 (light-green)?
- Just set up some Uranium 'smelters' (Centrifuges with Uranium processing Recipe), and store the Uranium in some chests. The centrifuges will output an Uranium-235/light-green occasionally (0.7% change). Let the smelters run for quite a while. Once you have 40 Uranium-235, you can start the automation.

Usage:
- Build the blueprint(s)
- For each centrifuge at the top: add at LEAST 40 Uranium-235/light-green (or just fill it completely)
- Connect the input belt of Uranium-238/dark-green

Notes:
- The input belt can be 'pure' Uranium-238/dark-green, but also a mixture directly from the 'smelters', with an occasional Uranium-235/light-green in it.
- There are no unnecessary loops of Uranium-235! If the centrifuge is finished with his 'batch', the first inserter outputs the Uranium, then a second one directly inserts them again, this way the Uranium does not need to loop the whole belt again. For this to work, the input-inserter (Uranium-235/light-green) only activates if nothing is on the output belt or inside the output inserters.
- Once the centrifuge has 80 or more Uranium-235/light-green in it, it does not need any Uranium-235/light-green from the input belt anymore, that's why 1 splitted belt as an input is enough for many centrifuges. The Uranium-235 is just there if you want to quickly expand by putting down blueprints, you don't need to manually fill the other centrifuges then, after a while they automatically get filled by the input belt. The only exception to this is the first (starting) centrifuge (which needs 40 Uranium-235 to get started).
- ~~REMEMBER: for the horizontal blueprint: if you use a mixed input belt (from a smelter, with occasional Uranium-235 in it), the 'output' of the belt on the end is **still mixed!** You can just use a splitter with a filter after the whole setup to make sure you have a clean belt of Uranium-238 to continue (just merge the Uranium-235 with the existing lane below, and set it to input priority, so the input line does not eventually block)~~ **UPDATE 19-07-2020:** This is now fixed by adding an extra belt + filtered splitter, so the outputs are clean: one belt of Uranium-238 and one belt of Uranium-235.
- A minimum of 40 Uranium-235 in the first centrifuge is required to start it, but 80 (or just fill it entirely once) is better because it then has enough Uranium to restart instantly after it finishes.
- There is also a speaker which will show an alert if there is not enough Uranium-238/dark-green (no sound, only an icon), so you always know when your setup does not have enough resources to continue producing (remove the speaker if you don't need/want that feature)
- If you do not have that much power when you start, you can easily remove the Beacon's for example, and add them later again with the blueprint.
- You can remove the constant combinators if you want, they are just there to indicate the resource type for the belts.

Enjoy!


*update: 19-07-2020:*
- removed 'vertical start' blueprint, just use one startpoint just to keep it simpler
- replace Medium electric poles with Substations (robots make a mess of adding diagonal wiring, this is easier to fix)
- added an extra belt+filter to ensure the outputs are clean!
